characters.name: Amy
characters.description: Amy is an Asian girl who is 23, who grew up in a rich environment and studied at Cornell. She had been in a place of privilege for her whole life and has barely faced any adversity. She is highly educated and is well connected with investors. Furthermore, she wanted to start a company to do something with her life. Also, she is what she calls a girl boss, or a feminist, who believes women empowerment is key in today’s world. The girl’s father is a big bank’s CEO, and she seriously wants to make her father proud.

characters.name: Tracy
characters.description: Tracy is a Mixed (American Asian) 24-year-old girl, who grew up in a poor environment, and busted her ass to get to where she was. She grew up with just her mother because her father went to jail. She went to community college but felt that community college did not bring anything to the table. She was able to quit her job, and start her startup. She also loves collaborating with other people and listening to what other people have to say. This is why a lot of her workers love to work with her. She is what people define as a hustler and more of a Mark Zuckerberg type.

characters.name: Lucas
characters.description: Lucas is a Thai 25-year-old male. He is from a middle-class family. He did not get the best grades in school and went to a mediocre school. There he partied a lot and did not go to class much. When he got into the real world, he started to realize it is necessary to work hard to succeed once he got out of school. Once he started work, he was fired multiple times by big companies. Eventually, he wanted to start his own company with his colleagues and friends, to build more of a family dynamic in the new company. He is like Richard Branson. Though he hustles, having a good time is the most essential thing for him.

characters.name: James
characters.description: James is a Japanese 18-year-old male, who just finished college. He excelled in everything he had done, including getting perfect grades, getting in Stanford with a full scholarship. He had even built multiple apps and companies before and sold them for millions of dollars. Right now he is building his new venture and is aspiring to make this company take over the world. He works every day till 8 o clock at night and sometimes sleeps at the office. Because of his commitment to work he doesn’t have much of social life. He is what people call a nerd because he almost has no social skills, but his work ethic is unmatched. He aspires to be more like Steve Jobs.

tutorial.start:
Welcome to STEM Unicorn! There are 3 objectives for this game:

  • Learn about entrepreneurship
  • Learn about STEM
  • Have Fun!

In this game, you will be able to be a virtual entrepreneur starting a STEM startup. The aim is to become a unicorn - a 1 billion dollar company. Each decision will impact the next level, so choose carefully!


What is a startup?:
A startup is a young company founded by one or more entrepreneurs to develop a unique product or service and bring it to market.

What is the difference between a startup and a large company?:
A startup is a temporary organization designed to search for a repeatable and scalable business model. In contrast, a large company executes - sells a product or service in exchange for revenue and profit - with an established business model.

Why do most startups fail?:
Most startups fail because they fail to make something someone wants to buy from them.
tutorial.mid:
A chief technology officer (CTO) is the highest technology executive position within a company and leads the technology or engineering department. They develop policies and procedures and use technology to enhance products and services that focus on external customers.

A chief financial officer (CFO) is the senior executive responsible for managing the financial actions of a company. The CFO's duties include tracking cash flow and financial planning as well as analyzing the company's financial strengths and weaknesses and proposing corrective actions.

The chief operating officer (COO) is a senior executive tasked with overseeing the day-to-day administrative and operational functions of a business. The COO typically reports directly to the chief executive officer (CEO) and is considered to be second in the chain of command.
